pullRequest.title: Simplify extra large domains in JDBC connectors by default

commit.message: Move basic pushdown types to PredicatePushdownController

nodes.bodyText: Add to commit message that you actually enable simplification of pushed down domain in this comit
With this you are changing the default value to 32. Why so?
more precisely, to IN list, or sequence of OR'd range conditions

commit.message:
Compact pushed domains in JDBC by default (with default limit of 32)

Previously there was no compaction threshold for most JDBC connectors.
Pushed domains are transformed into SQL IN lists in JDBC connectors.
Having more than 1000 elements within IN list causes significant query slowdown.
Even such a small number as 100 elements cause regressions. In other parts of
Presto we use 32 as compaction threshold as it provides reasonable balance
between performance and pushdown capabilities. If large IN lists are required,
compaction threshold can still be changed for query via session property.

Allow connector to specify max domain size

Previosly Oracle and Sql server connectors had custom code to
support compaction threshold limit.

afterCommit.message:
Allow connector to specify max domain size

Previosly Oracle and Sql server connectors had custom code to
support compaction threshold limit.
